item.title: Flashing Sidebar Icon not working
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“lare69, post:3, topic:541309”][quote author=Pure_ link=topic=660182.msg4414391#msg4414391 date=1395157189]
[size=18pt]Read the wiki.[/size]
[/quote]
^^ if you find all of the data you’re sending to the client matches the wiki you may have to fix the packet client sided… a lot of packets don’t work without modifications to the client (eg: music, sounds, hint icon, etc).[/quote]I fix the ones which are incorrect as I experiment with them, this packet works the way it is described.

Read full topic

item.title: Flashing Sidebar Icon not working
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

Pure_:

[size=18pt]Read the wiki.[/size]

^^ if you find all of the data you’re sending to the client matches the wiki you may have to fix the packet client sided… a lot of packets don’t work without modifications to the client (eg: music, sounds, hint icon, etc).

item.title: Flashing Sidebar Icon not working
item.dc:creator: @horjg horjg
item.description:
@horjg wrote:

I’ve been attempting to get this working now for a couple of hours. Searching around reaped no results. I need help with my flashSidebar packet.

This is my packet

public void flashSidebar(int i) { if(c.outStream != null && c != null ) { c.outStream.createFrame(24); c.outStream.writeByteA(i); c.flushOutStream(); System.out.println("FLASHING ICON "+i); } }

and this is me trying to use it

Console does read

FLASHING ICON 11

when flashSidebar is called.

Read full topic
